description:
Tension refers to how tightly or loosely the yarn is knitted. It directly affects gauge, fabric feel, and fit.

On a knitting machine, tension is adjusted by the tension dial on the carriage. A lower number produces tighter knitting (smaller stitches), while a higher number produces looser knitting (larger stitches).

Even slight changes in yarn thickness, fiber, or weather conditions can affect tensionâ€”so always knit and measure a swatch before starting your project.
tooltip: How tight or loose the knitting is, adjusted by the tension dial on the machine.
example: Try knitting a swatch at tension 6, then at tension 7 to see the difference in stitch size.
